name: sfchronicle
text: 31 years ago, the ground shook in Northern California, from outside Santa Cruz to San Francisco and far beyond, leaving devastation in its wake. https://t.co/deCKTbRdLl

name: sfchronicle
text: As of October 16, local health departments have reported 42,206 cases of the coronavirus among state health care workers, marking an increase of 222 reported cases from the day before, according to California Department of Public Health data. https://t.co/UmuF4OskaR

name: sfchronicle
text: The first Americans to gain access to vaccines will likely be health care workers and first responders — including those who work in ICUs and emergency departments — who make up about 5% of the population. https://t.co/tSuyLrdlvF

name: sfchronicle
text:
A year after they were defined by their ability to harass quarterbacks, the 49ers are already out of elite pass rushers. And they will be out of playoff contention before Election Day if quarterback Jimmy Garoppolo doesn’t start playing at an elite level.
https://t.co/R2pntSTlaa

name: sfchronicle
text:
@JaneKim @jachristian “We’re all in the fight for our lives,” said one red-cloaked protester from San Jose. “I’m scared that my rights will be taken away.”

Read more on the S.F. Women's March: https://t.co/9gS6fYt8FJ

name: sfchronicle
text:
JUST IN: Firefighters were responding to a blaze that was threatening homes in Vacaville on Saturday afternoon, fire officials said. A roughly 1.5-acre fire was blazing on Vine Street.

https://t.co/rA1jrfWYaI

name: sfchronicle
text: Maki the Lemur is safely back at the @sfzoo. Here’s the story of his mysterious disappearance and eventual recapture at a Daly City playground: https://t.co/Y9M4UAqMbw

name: sfchronicle
text: “Remdesivir is not a magic bullet. That’s pretty much a reality, but there is a place in therapy for it. If my grandmother came in with COVID, I would definitely want to give her remdesivir.” https://t.co/qmYgjykZho

name: sfchronicle
text: In a city obsessed with sourdough everything, one man is baking loaves stuffed with garlic, bacon and hot links. https://t.co/RKq2SkV1et

name: sfchronicle
text:
UPDATE: A blaze in Vacaville has prompted evacuations and was threatening homes, officials said. Residents living along Markham Ave and other nearby streets were being evacuated. 

Vacaville's Fire Chief said crews are "getting a real good handle on it." 

https://t.co/yXbHgl8v5u

name: sfchronicle
text: In San Francisco, protesters along Market Street chanted “Dump Trump, No Roe, Amy Barrett has got to go.” They waved signs in the bright pink of Planned Parenthood, one of five women’s rights groups that organized the event. https://t.co/9DQHnb6SB0

name: sfchronicle
text: Five preschoolers got an exciting extracurricular lesson Thursday afternoon when they watched handlers recapture Maki, the San Francisco Zoo’s missing lemur, after he hopped into their playground. https://t.co/jvq5MmlSdW

name: sfchronicle
text: Even leading up to what is traditionally the most popular travel time of the year, far fewer people are venturing onto airplanes. People are booking closer to their travel dates, prioritizing health and safety over ticket prices. https://t.co/90WKtDBeo7 https://t.co/Gmv4pswXk9

name: sfchronicle
text:
Punches and injuries punctuated a tense face-off at San Francisco’s United Nations Plaza on Saturday, where hundreds of anti-fascists gathered to oppose a small pro-Trump group holding a free speech rally. 

https://t.co/zIMltAYsEB

name: sfchronicle
text:
SFPD said six people were injured, including three officers, during clashes between a small group of President Trump’s supporters and a larger crowd of counter-protesters on Sunday near Civic Center. No arrests had been made as of early Saturday evening.

https://t.co/MtcsiVly7V

name: sfchronicle
text:
“D.A. Boudin remains committed to improving the way sexual assault cases are handled and has been actively working to protect survivors.”

None of that commitment comes through in the survey, though. https://t.co/UlpDLVyi2W

name: sfchronicle
text: The Glass Fire burned buildings at some of Napa Valley's most celebrated wineries and vineyards. Here are the latest updates from the 27 properties that suffered damage or were destroyed. https://t.co/Ha9AmM8Vfa

name: sfchronicle
text:
Latest on the Creek Fire burning in Fresno and Madera counties: 

- 346,477 acres burned
- 60% contained
- 983 structures destroyed 

Stay updated on California wildfires with our Fire Tracker: https://t.co/38GTi33wPW

name: sfchronicle
text:
The CZU Lightning Complex created an unprecedented hazard.

One couple calls it the “doomsday scenario": intense rainfall triggering mudslides that threaten the properties and lives of thousands of people in the Santa Cruz Mountains.

https://t.co/nitYGp2xV1

name: sfchronicle
text:
House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said that she and President Trump’s negotiators must come to an agreement on a stimulus relief package in the next 48 hours if they want to pass a bill before election day. 
https://t.co/lojxF6wTCL

text:
“In the South you had the cotton fields, and here we had the gold mines."

Hundreds of enslaved people were already living in California at the time of its admission to the union in 1850, forced to work in mines and on plantations.

text:
Today, two people were killed in in separate shootings in Oakland, police said.

East Oakland has emerged as the epicenter of a wave of shootings and homicides in a city that has logged more than 80 slayings in 2020.
https://t.co/MFBx5Luepl

name: sfchronicle
text: The number of people hospitalized with COVID-19 in the nine Bay Area counties fell to 264 on Saturday, down from 266 on Sunday and vastly below the peak of over 800 in late July. The last time figures were this low was in June. https://t.co/pBcmbJvtme

name: sfchronicle
text:

Here's why the region remains an outlier:
